get.description: Get list of Enterprise Dispatchers, use only if you have more than one Enterprise Dispatchers
Check if default Enterprise Dispatcher is manually disabled

parameters.name: id_enterprise_dispatcher
parameters.description: if not pass value, it will use a default

get.description: Check if specific Enterprise Dispatcher is disabled

tags: Create SolidCP All in One User/Package/Vps
post.description: Correct way to create VPS for SolidCP panel. It will automatically create user, package and VPS if needed.

client_login.description: The login that the user will use for the SolidCP panel

client_email.description: The email that the user will use in the SolidCP panel, if forget password

server_ip_amount.description: The number of IP addresses to be assigned to the VM server.

id_enterprise_dispatcher.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

ignore_node_ids.description: nodes ids that need to ignore for installation (all storages that related to this node). For example, if the old installation is not yet complete

ignore_hosting_space_ids.description: hostingspace ids (storages) that need to ignore for installation. For example, if the old installation is not yet complete

is_user_exists.description: if false, this user was not created, but the old one with the same login was used (the password was not changed)

solidcp_package_id.description: The package in which the virtual machine is installed

hostname.description: VM hostname and name of SolidCP item

solidcp_server_node.description: The Node/HDD in which the virtual machine was installed.

solidcp_hosting_space_id.description: SolidCP hosting space aka Storage HDD/SSD/NAS/etc

link.description: Get VPS Provisioning Status. Whether the server is prepared or not, until returns OK or Error

post.description: Manually create a SolidCP user. Not required if you are using All in One User/Package/Vps

first_name.description: if not selected, then use the username

last_name.description: if not selected, then use the username

id_enterprise_dispatcher.description: if not selected, then use the default one

get.description: Check if the user exists. Not required if you are using All in One User/Package/Vps

parameters.name: id_enterprise_dispatcher
parameters.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

get.description: Get VPS Provisioning Status. Whether the server is prepared or not. Should be used after calling All in One User/Package/Vps

parameters.name: solidcp_item_id
parameters.description: the id that provides the VPS creation method

parameters.name: id_enterprise_dispatcher
parameters.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

get.description: Get state of VM Running/Stopped/ets. Must be used only if VPS Provisioning Status shows - OK

parameters.name: solidcp_item_id
parameters.description: the id that provides the VPS creation method

parameters.name: id_enterprise_dispatcher
parameters.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

state.description: After installation, we need to get the state = Running, everything else in this case means a problem. If state = Starting, then need to wait.
state.example: Snapshotting or Migrating or Deleted or Unknown or Other or Running or Off or Stopping or Saved or Paused or Starting or Reset or Saving or Pausing or Resuming or FastSaved or FastSaving or RunningCritical or OffCritical or StoppingCritical or SavedCritical or PausedCritical or StartingCritical or ResetCritical or SavingCritical or PausingCritical or ResumingCritical or FastSavedCritical or FastSavingCritical

get.description: Get state of VM Running/Stopped/ets. Use it only if you need to check a state of a VM after changing the VPS status

parameters.name: id_enterprise_dispatcher
parameters.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

state.description: After installation, we need to get the state = Running, everything else in this case means a problem. If state = Starting, then need to wait.
state.example: Snapshotting or Migrating or Deleted or Unknown or Other or Running or Off or Stopping or Saved or Paused or Starting or Reset or Saving or Pausing or Resuming or FastSaved or FastSaving or RunningCritical or OffCritical or StoppingCritical or SavedCritical or PausedCritical or StartingCritical or ResetCritical or SavingCritical or PausingCritical or ResumingCritical or FastSavedCritical or FastSavingCritical

put.description: Change VPS state over IPv4, that assigned to the client client_login. (Start or TurnOff or ShutDown or Reset or Pause or Save or Reboot or Resume)

id_enterprise_dispatcher.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

IsSuccess.description: Return true or false if Success

put.description: Change VPS and its packet status over IPv4, that assigned to the client client_login. Active/Suspended/Cancelled

id_enterprise_dispatcher.description: if not selected, the default is used. No need to choose if only one enterprise is used

get.description: Provides the number of available spaces for a specific package
